item.title: [HIVE-1207] ScriptOperator AutoProgressor does not set the interval

item.title: [HIVE-1208] Bug with error "cannot find ObjectInspector for VOID"
item.description:
This happens when using constant "null", but not when using "CAST(null AS STRING)".

explain extended FROM 
(select 1 as a, null as b
 from zshao_tt
 distribute by a) tmp
SELECT transform(a, b)
USING 'cat';
item.summary: Bug with error "cannot find ObjectInspector for VOID"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This is no longer reproducible on trunk.

item.title: [HIVE-1209] alter table replace columns does not check for partitioned columns
item.description:
create table foo (a int) partitioned by (b int);

alter table foo replace columns (a int, b int);

succeeds. It should fail appropriately
item.summary: alter table replace columns does not check for partitioned columns

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Marking as duplicate of HIVE-2415 which has more discussion.

item.title: [HIVE-1210] code cleanup for sort-merge join
item.description:
It would be good to have a operator->local work mapping.
The operator in question knows how to process the local work

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1211] Tapping logs from child processes
item.description: Stdout/stderr from child processes (e.g. MapRedTask) are redirected to the parent's stdout/stderr. There is little one can do to to sort out which log is from which query.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I'd like to change it to go through the SessionState first. SessionState will have two new PrintStream, called childOut and childErr, which are similar to the current out and err. They let users tap into the child's output. If they're null, then the child's out will continue on to stdout/stderr.

And this doesn't break any existing users who aren't interested in the child's output. They can tap into SessionState.out|err and ignore the new fields.
Hi bc, can you talk a bit more about the use case in your mind?

I'd like to retrieve the logs related to a particular query.

SessionState.out and SessionState.err are meant for that exact purpose. Unfortunately, they don't capture the child processes' output, which currently goes directly to System.out and System.err. Therefore this patch introduces SessionState.childout and SessionState.childerr, which by default (null) do nothing. But it allows anyone to hook a stream there to get the child's output.
Hi bc, sorry for the delay in looking at this. Can you please rebase this patch against trunk and resubmit? Thanks!
Updated patch on 0.6 branch.
@Carl, can you take a look ?

Rebased the patch to trunk.

+1

item.title: [HIVE-1212] Explicitly say "Hive Internal Error" to ease debugging
item.description:
Our users complain that hive fails error messages like "FAILED: Unknown exception: null".

We should explicitly mention that's an internal error of Hive, and provide more information (stacktrace) on the screen to ease bug reporting and debugging.

In other cases, we will still put the detailed information (stacktrace) in the log, since users should be able to figure out what's wrong with a single line of message.
item.summary: Explicitly say "Hive Internal Error" to ease debugging

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This also fixes UDFArgumentException reporting.
Cleaned up some error processing code.
In QTestUtil.java, there are a few repeated println(error string) calls. Could you either consolidate those to a common string or function call?
Addressed the comment from Paul.
Looks good +1
OK. I'll test and commit.
Committed. Thanks Zheng!

item.title: [HIVE-1213] sort-merge join does not work for sub-queries
item.description:
A query like:

select count(1) from (select /*+ MAPJOIN */ from x join y ON ... ) subq;

does not work - since there is no mapping between the join operator and the corresponding source
item.summary: sort-merge join does not work for sub-queries

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
set hive.enforce.bucketing = true;
set hive.enforce.sorting = true;

drop table bucketmapjoin6_1;
CREATE TABLE bucketmapjoin6_1(key int, value string) CLUSTERED BY (key) SORTED BY (key) INTO 2 BUCKETS;

drop table bucketmapjoin6_2;
CREATE TABLE bucketmapjoin6_2(key int, value string) CLUSTERED BY (key) SORTED BY (key) INTO 2 BUCKETS;

drop table bucketmapjoin6_3;
CREATE TABLE bucketmapjoin6_3(key int, value string) CLUSTERED BY (key) SORTED BY (key) INTO 2 BUCKETS;

insert overwrite table bucketmapjoin6_1
select * from src where key < 100 and key != 44 and key != 28 and key != 15;

select * from bucketmapjoin6_1;

insert overwrite table bucketmapjoin6_2
select * from src where key > 20 and key < 50;

select * from bucketmapjoin6_2;

insert overwrite table bucketmapjoin6_3
select * from src where key > 10 and key < 30;

select * from bucketmapjoin6_3;

explain
select * from
(
select
CASE
WHEN M.key is not null THEN M.key
ELSE S.key
END as key,
M.value as Mvalue, S.value as Svalue from
(select * from bucketmapjoin6_1 where (key <= 20 or key >= 50) ) M full outer join bucketmapjoin6_2 S on
M.key = S.key
) subq2
full outer join
bucketmapjoin6_3 L
on subq2.key = L.key;

set hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin = true;
set hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin.sortedmerge = true;

explain
select /*+ MAPJOIN(L) */ * from
(
select /*+ MAPJOIN(S) */
CASE
WHEN M.key is not null THEN M.key
ELSE S.key
END as key,
M.value as Mvalue, S.value as Svalue from
(select * from bucketmapjoin6_1 where (key <= 20 or key >= 50) ) M full outer join bucketmapjoin6_2 S on
M.key = S.key
) subq2
full outer join
bucketmapjoin6_3 L
on subq2.key = L.key;

set hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin = false;
select * from
(
select
CASE
WHEN M.key is not null THEN M.key
ELSE S.key
END as key,
M.value as Mvalue, S.value as Svalue from
(select * from bucketmapjoin6_1 where (key <= 20 or key >= 50) ) M full outer join bucketmapjoin6_2 S on
M.key = S.key
) subq2
full outer join
bucketmapjoin6_3 L
on subq2.key = L.key;

—

The mapjoin query should be executed as a single map-only job
Still need one more change to convert the mapjoin to a sorted merge map join. Will update the patch after that change.
A new patch. join32 and join33 fails with this patch.
A patch ready for review.
Hive-1213.6.patch has no code change. only added one more testcase which has a dummy transform in a subquery.

got some diffs

bucketmapjoin_subquery.q, input2.q and input3.q

Also, test TestHashMapWrapper failed with a NPE
fixed the bucketmapjoin_subquery.q diff, and added some comments in code. Thanks Namit!

Consider the query;

select /*+ MAPJOIN(c) */ ...
from

(

select /*+ MAPJOIN(b) */ .. from a join b on k1

) subq
join
c
on k2

Even if k1 and k2 are not same, this can be done in a singe map-only job. Note that this has nothing to do with sorting/bucketing etc.
Integrated Namit's comment about subquery mapjoin. Thanks Namit!
some logic is moved to HIVE-1246. update the patch.
The patch does not apply cleanly

item.title: [HIVE-1214] sort-merge join should work for descending sort also
item.description: Currently, if the data is not sorted in a ascending order, sort-merge join does not work
item.summary: sort-merge join should work for descending sort also

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1215] bogus assertion in GroupByOperator.initializeOp
item.description:
export HADOOP_OPTS="-ea"

and then run the following query in Hive:

select count(1) from pokes;

This causes an assertion failure:

Caused by: java.lang.AssertionError
at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.GroupByOperator.initializeOp(GroupByOperator.java:161)
at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.Operator.initialize(Operator.java:344)
at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.ExecReducer.configure(ExecReducer.java:143)
... 10 more

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: We have tests for such queries, and we enable assertions in the junit ant task, but we do not seem to be enabling assertions for the forked JVM's which execute the plan. We should find a way to address this in order to get more coverage for assertions (and also to expose any more bogus ones).

Yes you can reproduce this by a simple edit in build common and a q file that
does select count(1) from src;

 <target name="test"
        depends="test-conditions,gen-test,compile-test,test-jar,test-init">
    <!--<property name="testcp" refid="test.classpath"/>-->
    <!--<echo message="test.classpath: ${testcp}"/>-->
    <junit showoutput="${test.output}" printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="no"
           fork="yes" maxmemory="512m" dir="${basedir}" timeout="${test.timeout}"
           errorProperty="tests.failed" failureProperty="tests.failed" filtertrace="off">
      <!--
      <jvmarg value="-Xdebug"/>
      <jvmarg value="-Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,address=8000,server=y,suspend=y"/> -->
      <env key="HADOOP_OPTS" value="-ea" />
      <env key="HADOOP_HOME" value="${hadoop.root}"/>
      <env key="TZ" value="US/Pacific"/>

This be easy to add.
<env key="HADOOP_OPTS" value="-ea" />
or
<env key="HADOOP_OPTS" value="${HADOOP_OPTS} -ea" />

item.title: [HIVE-1216] Show the row with error in mapper/reducer
item.description: It will be very useful for user to debug the HiveQL if mapper/reducer can show the row that caused error.
item.summary: Show the row with error in mapper/reducer

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I think this is already done by HADOOP-3828.

Thanks for the link Jeff. This JIRA aims to do a bit different thing.
Instead of writing the data into _skip file and letting the job finish, we will print out the row to stderr/stdout or just using LOG.

The advantage of this:
1. Really easy for debugging - people don't need to use command line tools to fetch the _skip file.
2. Should be able to attach column names with their values, because Hive knows the column names.
This patch fixes some checkstyle warnings.
Looks good. will commit after tests pass.
I got a diff in the new testcase
